page.title: 09Police at Aboyne
page.content: Two Constables are stationed at Aboyne, forming part of a team cover for the wider area which includes Aboyne. Their role is to guard, patrol and protect, detect offenders and report them if necessary. In addition the constables are involved in the community at both professional and personal levels. Theft is the most common crime, mainly of items valued up to Â£500. There are frequent breaches of the peace and road traffic offences. Drug abuse is becoming a problem. Detection rates are at 50 to 60% in rural areas - higher than in urban areas.
